alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 11:54AM CDT until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Chambers, Harris, Liberty and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1154 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Rainfall rates between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in portions of the advisory area, and are expected to spread across the rest of the advisory area over the next hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baytown, Humble, southwestern Liberty, Dayton, Beach City, Kingwood, Spring, Crosby, Mont Belvieu, Splendora, Patton Village, Roman Forest, Woodbranch, Old River-Winfree, Plum Grove, Kenefick, Cove, Lake Houston, northern Atascocita and Porter Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
